meanings.definition: A person who is at the forefront or leading position in a particular field or activity.
meanings.sent1: The fronter of the team always comes up with new ideas.
meanings.sent2: The fronter in the race crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The fronter of the class had the brightest smile.
meanings.sent4: She was the fronter of the dance floor, moving with grace and confidence.
meanings.sent5: Being the fronter means taking charge and setting the pace for others to follow.

meanings.definition: A person who is on the front lines or in the front ranks of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The medical team's fronter bravely faced the challenges head-on.
meanings.sent2: The army fronter led the troops into battle.
meanings.sent3: The fronter of the protest held up a witty sign.
meanings.sent4: She stood as the fronter of the line, ready to take on any obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The fronter's courage inspired those behind to keep pushing forward.
